OOC: LOL! I can definitly understand as how folks could get upset with
how Tuscon is acting, he does seem to be especially mean and ornery
these days.

Just as an FYI Tuscon is suppose to be going through some problems
that he is having to come to terms with, mainly anger and agression
due in part to his new form. I would suspect that its instincts and
temperment is making Tuscon's already short tempor even shorter. So
that is why Tuscon is acting more angry and aggressive then normal. So
if we can, let's try to deal with that aspect in character as best as
we can and give Tuscon some really good RP.

But we can also think that Wheelie's temporment also gives us a good
chance for RP, since we know that he tends to cut pretty deep also.
It's the interation that makes things fun. I look foward to it.

You know though as a thought, I would have imagine that Rat Trap would
know how to deal with it better than most. Rat Trap is a simlar style
character. He doesn't usually resort to conflict, but rather letting
his mouth do all the talking - you know how he and Dinobot got along
:)

Now as to power posing, I am perfectly fine with Wheelie ignoring the
implied damage that he took and just side stepping it. No character
can pose the damage another character takes, he can only pose the
circumstances around it and let the other person around it choose what
is to happen.

As for posting, I will let the others post first. I don't want to go
to fast for everyone :)

- Preston

On 8/22/11, adamsafran <adamsafran@...> wrote:
>
> OOC Uhm, Quartz, Wheelie was basically giving your characters some sass, but
> then Rattrap and  Straight Shot then tried to assault him, which if it had
> worked would have sent him to the medbay, and now Tuscon is getting in Leo
> Prime's face for having attempted to stop Autobots from starting a fight in
> the medbay.  I'm aware he's your character and protecting his sister, but I
> can't see this exactly as something a Prime would do. :)
>
> And in the future, please don't powerpose me, pranks or otherwise -
> especially when it comes to something that would inflict significant damage,
> liek slamming him into quills!
>
>
